intro: Galium subvelutinum var. leiophyllum, commonly known as the smoothleaf bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves. The leaves are typically smooth and have a lanceolate or ovate shape, with a slightly hairy underside. It produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
